data.content:
verb
US or Brit appal -palls; -palled; -palling
[+ obj] :to cause (someone) to feel fear, shock, or disgust
The thought of war appalls me.
It appalls me to think of the way those children have been treated. - often used as (be) appalled
We were appalled at how long it took for our food to be served. = We were appalled that it took so long.
She was appalled by/at their behavior.
